head.title: Mets Considering Clement To Shore Up Pitching Staff

hedline.hl1: Mets Considering Clement To Shore Up Pitching Staff

abstract.p: Trade speculation concerning New York Mets discussed (S)

block.p: The Yankees are not the only local team considering a deal for San Diego pitcher Matt Clement. The Mets, too, were talking to the Padres late last night about a trade for Clement, a hard-throwing right-hander, according to a baseball official. One proposal would have the Mets sending their star outfield prospect, Alex Escobar, and others to the Padres for Clement and reliever Donne Wall.
The Mets, who have been trying to find ways to upgrade their roster, have also been discussing deals with the Pittsburgh Pirates for outfielder John Vander Wal.

The Mets have made substantive deals in the days leading to today's trading deadline, adding shortstop Mike Bordick in a five-player trade with the Baltimore Orioles, and reliever Rick White and outfielder Bubba Trammell in a four-player deal with the Tampa Bay Devil Rays.
